alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Upper Green River Basin; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 10:28AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARK...WESTERN BIG HORN...HOT SPRINGS...WESTERN WASHAKIE AND WESTERN AND CENTRAL FREMONT COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. At 1025 AM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 7 miles west of Elk Basin to Cody to Crowheart to 6 miles southwest of Oregon Buttes and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Oregon Buttes around 1030 AM MST. Elk Basin around 1035 AM MST. Deaver and Frannie around 1055 AM MST. Cowley around 1105 AM MST. Lovell around 1110 AM MST. Crooked Creek Natural Area around 1115 AM MST. Horseshoe Bend and Bighorn Lake around 1120 AM MST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
